clinical_study.brief_title: Vancomycin Dose Adjustments Comparing Trough Levels to The AUC/MIC Method Using a Bayesian Approach in a Hospitalized Adult Population
clinical_study.official_title: Vancomycin Dose Adjustments Comparing Trough Levels to The AUC0-24h/MIC Method Using a Bayesian Approach in a Hospitalized Adult Population: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study is a prospective, randomized, controlled, open-label trial to assess the feasibility of a randomized controlled trial of sufficient quality that would assess the efficacy and safety of vancomycin adjustments according to Area under the curve/Minimal inhibitory concentration (AUC0-24h/MIC) calculated by the Bayesian approach rather than by a trough dosage. Randomization will be stratified according to infection severity. Approximately 60 subjects meeting all inclusion and no exclusion criteria will be randomized to have pharmacists perform vancomycin dose adjustments with AUC0-24h / MIC calculated by the Bayesian approach versus the trough dosage approach.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of adhesion rate to the sampling protocol of 80% or more and adhesion rate to software recommendations of 90% or more
Evaluation of consent rate of 30% or more and the number of patients recruited per month of 10 or more

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patients who reach a therapeutic level in the first 48 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 48 hours after the first dose of vancomycin
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients who reach a therapeutic level in the first 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to reach the vancomycin target
secondary_outcome.description: Number of hours necessary to reach the vancomycin target. Number of hours will be classified in the following categories: 24-48 hours, 49-96 hours, 97 hours and above.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of adjustments required to reach the vancomycin target
secondary_outcome.description: Number of dose adjustments required to reach the vancomycin target

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of vancomycin dosage level monitoring to reach the vancomycin target
secondary_outcome.description: The number of vancomycin dosage level monitoring to reach the vancomycin target

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of vancomycin dosage level monitoring in the vancomycin target
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of vancomycin dosage level monitoring in the vancomycin target

secondary_outcome.measure: The difference between the AUC calculated by the Bayesian method and the trapezoid method
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in percentage of the vancomycin AUC calculated by the Bayesian method and the trapezoid method

secondary_outcome.measure: The difference between the initial prescribed dose and the dose suggested by the Bayesian software.
secondary_outcome.description: Difference in percentage of the initial prescribed dose and the dose suggested by the Bayesian software.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Average of the daily dose of vancomycin calculated in mg per kg of total body weight
Evaluation of the impact on pharmacist's time required for monitoring vancomycin

arm_group.description: Pharmacists will perform vancomycin dose adjustments according to AUC0-24h/MIC using the Bayesian method with a web application
Pharmacists will perform vancomycin dose adjustments according to trough levels of vancomycin.

intervention.intervention_name: Vancomycin dose adjustment using the Bayesian method
intervention.description: This intervention is the experimental method. The AUC/MIC target is 400-600 mg*hour/L.

intervention.intervention_name: Vancomycin dose adjustment using the trough level method
intervention.description: This intervention is the standard method. Previous clinical guidelines recommended this method. The trough target is 10-15 mg/L for non-severe infections and 15-20 mg/L for severe infections.
